note_text:
HISTORY: Mr. Martinez, a 66-year-old male with newly diagnosed right upper lobe adenocarcinoma, presented for mediastinal staging. 
PROCEDURE: Moderate sedation was induced. A linear EBUS scope was introduced. A systematic nodal evaluation was performed. Transbronchial needle aspiration (TBNA) was conducted at stations 4R, 7, 10R, and 11R. Rapid On-Site Evaluation (ROSE) confirmed malignancy in stations 4R and 7. 
CONCLUSION: N2 disease confirmed. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

note_text:
Procedure: EBUS-TBNA (CPT 31653).
Technique: 
1. Ultrasound evaluation of mediastinal and hilar nodes.
2. Needle aspiration (22G) of Station 4R, Station 7, Station 10R, and Station 11R (>3 stations sampled).
3. Cell block preparation and ROSE service utilized for all samples.
Outcome: Adequate tissue obtained from all 4 sites. Malignancy identified in mediastinum.

31623.rationale: Flexible bronchoscopy with brush cytology (×2) of the LLL basilar segments without transbronchial biopsy.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Diagnostic flexible bronchoscopy.
CLINICAL SUMMARY: Ms. Davis presented for evaluation of a persistent left lower lobe infiltrate. 
FINDINGS: The airway examination revealed moderate mucosal erythema and edema within the basilar segments of the left lower lobe. No endobronchial masses were appreciated.
INTERVENTION: Bronchoalveolar lavage and bronchial brushings were obtained from the affected segments for microbiologic and cytologic analysis. Transbronchial biopsies were deferred.
IMPRESSION: Inflammatory changes LLL, ruled out visible endobronchial lesion.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Endobronchial Ultrasound-Guided Transbronchial Needle Aspiration.
INDICATIONS: Mediastinal staging for lung carcinoma.
FINDINGS: Systematic ultrasound interrogation identified lymphadenopathy at stations 4R, 7, and 11R. Real-time sampling was performed. ROSE confirmed malignancy at stations 4R and 7. Station 11R yielded adequate lymphocytes but was negative for malignancy on preliminary review.
CONCLUSION: N2 positive disease.

evidence.dob: PT: RICHARD BROWN | ID#: MD-8472-K | DOB: 03/27/1952

31653.rationale: EBUS-TBNA staging with sampling of three nodal stations (4R, 10R, 11R). Station 7 was not accessible but extensive mediastinal disease was evaluated.

31641.rationale: Therapeutic bronchoscopy with argon plasma coagulation and tumor debulking of the right middle lobe bronchus causing 80% stenosis.

31636.rationale: Placement of a 12mm × 30mm metallic bronchial stent in the right middle lobe bronchus after debulking.

31627.rationale: Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy performed to target a 16mm LUL apical-posterior peripheral nodule.

31654.rationale: Radial EBUS used to confirm tool-in-lesion during peripheral nodule sampling.

31628.rationale: Transbronchial lung biopsies (three forceps biopsies) of the LUL peripheral nodule under EMN and radial EBUS guidance.

coding_review.bundling_notes: This is a complex combined procedure with mediastinal EBUS staging (31653), central airway debulking and stent placement (31641, 31636), and EMN-guided peripheral lung nodule biopsy (31627, 31654, 31628). Local billing rules may apply multiple procedure reductions and may bundle some peripheral biopsy services.

Radial EBUS view updated to Concentric to reflect documented tool-in-lesion confirmation.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Mr. Brown underwent a multimodal bronchoscopic procedure. 
1) EBUS Staging: Stations 4R, 10R, and 11R were sampled, confirming malignancy. Station 7 was inaccessible. 
2) Therapeutic Bronchoscopy: The RML bronchus was 80% occluded by tumor. This was debulked using forceps and APC, followed by placement of a 12x30mm metallic stent. 
3) Navigation: Electromagnetic navigation guided biopsy of a LUL apical-posterior nodule.
IMPRESSION: Advanced malignancy with airway palliation and nodule sampling.

note_text: This was a complex case for Mr. Brown involving staging, debulking, and biopsy. We started with EBUS, confirming malignancy in multiple stations. We then addressed the RML obstruction by debulking the tumor and placing a stent to keep the airway open. Finally, we used electromagnetic navigation to locate and biopsy a peripheral nodule in the left upper lobe.

evidence.primary_indication: INDICATION: RUL endobronchial lesion causing post-obstructive pneumonia + mediastinal LAD

notes: Distinct procedural targets (mediastinal nodes vs endobronchial tumor).

31653.rationale: Systematic EBUS-TBNA staging with sampling of four nodal stations (2R, 4R, 7, 10R) under general anesthesia.

coding_review.bundling_notes: 31653 covers mediastinal/hilar EBUS-TBNA staging; 31625 for endobronchial tumor biopsies is separately reportable. No stent removal occurs, so 31631 is not appropriate. Brushings are considered part of the bronchoscopic biopsy service and are not separately coded.

EBUS quality metrics (systematic staging, photodocumentation, ROSE) set to true based on the narrative.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopy with EBUS staging and endobronchial biopsy.
FINDINGS: EBUS evaluation of stations 2R, 4R, 7, and 10R was performed. Station 4R was positive for malignancy. Direct inspection revealed an endobronchial mass in the RUL causing obstruction. Multiple biopsies were taken from this lesion.
COMPLICATIONS: Intraprocedural hemorrhage managed with cold saline and epinephrine. Transient desaturation.
